author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
The government of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) has banned 16 books, including two authored by JKLF founder Maqbool Bhat, ostensibly for promoting pro-independence ideas.

A notification issued by the PoK establishment imposed a ban “on purchase, sale, import and exhibition of the 16 books” and directed the authorities to confiscate them from the market.

Leading separatist groups in Kashmir have termed as “uncalled for” the decision by PoK president Sardar Muhammad Yaqoob Khan.

All Parties Hurriyat Conference chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq said: “I believe there should be no reason to ban the books propagating pro-independence thought. The government there must reconsider the decision.”

Ayaz Akbar, spokesman for Syed Ali Geelani, chairman of Tehreek-e-Hurriyat, said: “It doesn’t suit democracy. The ban should be rolled back, and there should be no limitation on books written by the pro-independence authors.”
title: J&K separatists oppose ban on books in PoK
